intro: Dyssochroma albidoflavum, commonly known as the white-flowered dyssochroma, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a pale green to yellowish hue. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically white or pale yellow, which gives it its common name. Dyssochroma albidoflavum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
